column4: Hello, I need help installing Ubuntu via usb onto my netbook. I have make a drive but everytime I try to install all I get is "keyboard unrecocgnized" and the "boot: " prompt which doesn't allow key entries
if the netbook has an arm processor then I think you need the arm version of ubuntu or the netbook remix/unity
Hmm... I might, I'll double check
I don't think my eee pc is an ARM machine and I am just using the direct download iso from ubuntu's netbook page
is that a model bought outside of the US?
nope. Got it at yer friendly local large compu-retail store
I got on asus's site to reference and didn't come up with anything.. but looks like [thor] says it's an Intel
it has an intel atom processor and a newly installed intel SSD (originally had hitachi 160 gb drive)
just found that.. might be an issue with the ssd.. have you searched the ubuntuforums.org for others with the same problem?
I'm kinda doing that now (I've been away from home all week)
the only thing is the issues i'm getting seem to have to deal with the keyboard not the HD so i'm a little confused as to what to look for
I just tried an install again to get the exact wording of the error. it says "Unknown keyword in configuration file" no it's nothing with the keyboard i guess
then I get the "boot: " prompt again but it won't allow any entries
weird.. sorry I don't have any answers....

haha no problem. at least now I can say it wasn't just me. but now the issue of trying to remake the boot drive is more important. if i can at least troubleshoot by trying on different usbs i'd feel better but none of my usbs seem to be accepting a boot file

I think i'll be able to make one work, but the problem is i have an old OSX boot on there and for the life of my can't remember how to get it off (it says read-only) which makes me feel all kinds of foolish
